Package monkey.mnk

Class Alignment

  • java.lang.Object
    • monkey.mnk.Alignment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    public class Alignment
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    In an MNK-game, an Alignment is one of the possible arrangements in a straight line and of length K. If a Player fills an Alignment with K of their own marks, they win.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Alignment.Direction
      Starting from the top left cell of the Alignment, you can move following a cerain Direction to get to the others.
      static class  Alignment.State
      An Alignment can be in exactly one of the following States, depending on the marks added to it.

                 int length,
                 mnkgame.MNKCellState firstExt,

        Constructs a new empty Alignment given its coordinates.
        Parameters:
        firstCell - An initializer for FIRSTCELL
        direction - An initializer for DIRECTION
        length - An initializer for LENGTH
        firstExt - An initializer for firstExtremity
        secondExt - An initializer for secondExtremity
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - length is negative or zero
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - last cell out of firstCell's bounds
        java.lang.NullPointerException - firstCell, or direction, or both are null

        1.0

      • setFirstExtremity

        public void setFirstExtremity​(mnkgame.MNKCellState cell,
                              Board b)
        Sets the first extremity. Checks for weird behaviors, such as new cells appearing from nowhere and cells already marked being overwritten.
        Parameters:
        cell - The new state of the first extremity.
        b - The current state of the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalCallerException - The extremity cannot be changed anymore.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - setFirstExtremity(mnkgame.MNKCellState, monkey.mnk.Board) can be called, but the extremity cannot be set to this state.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setSecondExtremity(mnkgame.MNKCellState, monkey.mnk.Board)

      • setSecondExtremity

        public void setSecondExtremity​(mnkgame.MNKCellState cell,
                               Board b)
        Sets the second extremity. Checks for weird behaviors, such as new cells appearing from nowhere and cells already marked being overwritten.
        Parameters:
        cell - The new state of the second extremity.
        b - The current state of the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalCallerException - The extremity cannot be changed anymore.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - setSecondExtremity(mnkgame.MNKCellState, monkey.mnk.Board) can be called, but the extremity cannot be set to this state.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        setFirstExtremity(mnkgame.MNKCellState, monkey.mnk.Board)
